Consumer Class

Uses
  • handleEvents
Defined in: src/consumer.js:5

A freedom port for a user-accessable api.

getInterface

()

Defined in src/consumer.js:74

Create a consumer.Interface associated with this consumer. An interface is returned, which is supplied with important control of the api via constructor arguments: (bound below in getInterfaceConstructor)

onMsg: function(binder) sets the function to call when messages for this interface arrive on the channel, emit: function(msg) allows this interface to emit messages, id: string is the Identifier for this interface.

getInterfaceConstructor

() private

Defined in src/consumer.js:164

Provides a bound class for creating a consumer.Interface associated with this api. This partial level of construction can be used to allow the consumer to be used as a provider for another API.

getListener

(
  • name
)
private

Defined in src/consumer.js:94

Attach an 'onEvent' listener to an interface, allowing external consumers to either listen to channel state, or register callbacks on lifetime events of individual instances of the interface.

Parameters:

  • name String

    The event to listen to.

getProxyInterface

()

Defined in src/consumer.js:125

Create a function that can be used to get interfaces from this api consumer from a user-visible point.

  • type String | Function

  • handler Function
    The handler to run the next time a matching event is raised.

recursiveFreezeObject

(
  • obj
)
Object static

Defined in src/consumer.js:446

Recursively traverse a [nested] object and freeze its keys from being writable. Note, the result can have new keys added to it, but existing ones cannot be overwritten. Doesn't do anything for arrays or other collections.

Parameters:

  • obj Object
    • object to be frozen

Returns:

Object:

obj
